item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I think the only way to get through this life is laughing hard and constantly, mostly at myself." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "So what? All writers are lunatics!" -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "The true secret in being a hero lies in knowing the order of things. The swineherd cannot already be wed to the princess when he embarks on his adventures, nor can the boy knock on the witch's door when she is already away on vacation. The wicked uncle cannot be found out and foiled before he does something wicked. Things must happen when it is time for them to happen. Quests may not simply be abandoned; prophecies may not be left to rot like unpicked fruit; unicorns may go unrescued for a very long time, but not forever. The happy ending cannot come in the middle of the story." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "The Queen's Pride was his ship, and he loved her. (That was the way his sentences always went: It is raining today and I love you. My cold is better and I love you. Say hello to Horse and I love you. Like that.)" -- William Goldman

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Ford... you're turning into a penguin. Stop it." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the chemist's, but that's just peanuts to space." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Edwin Markham
item.description:
"He drew a circle that shut me out- Heretic , rebel, a thing to flout. But love and I had the wit to win: We drew a circle and took him In !
From the poem " Outwitted" -- Edwin Markham

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Every woman is a rebel." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth Ann add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie
